raw_comment: This graph depicts the comparison between the 2 age groups (15-24 yr olds) and (40+ yr olds) optimism towards the future of the earth. I notice that the younger generation is more likely to believe that the world is getting better. However, 40+ year olds are not as likely to hold the same belief. I also notice that the 25-40 age group was not included in this graph, I wonder why this was. I wonder why the adults have such a negative outlook on the future, or if it is because they have lived longer and seen more.

The first age group is the group of 15-24-year-olds.
The second age group is the group of people who are 40 years old or older.
The graph is about optimism toward the future of the Earth.
I notice that the younger generation is more likely to believe that the world is getting better.
I notice that people who are 40 years old or older are less likely to believe that the world is getting better.
The graph does not include the age group of 25-40-year-olds.
I wonder why the graph does not include the age group of 25-40-year-olds.
I wonder why adults have a negative outlook on the future.
I wonder if adults have a negative outlook because they have lived longer.
